channel.title: Watch This Space
channel.description: Join NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine as he explores all aspects of America's space program and embeds you into critical conversations about how NASA pioneers the future in space exploration, scientific discovery and aeronautics research.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Watch This Space audio podcast episodes
channel.itunes:summary: Join NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine as he explores all aspects of America's space program and embeds you into critical conversations about how NASA pioneers the future in space exploration, scientific discovery and aeronautics research.
channel.itunes:keywords: NASA, NASA science, spaceflight, space exploration, International Space Station, astronauts
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

item.title: Watch This Space: NASA Administrator Bridenstine Chats with Elon Musk of SpaceX
item.description: On the latest Watch this Space, NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine chats with SpaceX CEO and Chief Designer Elon Musk during a tour of Launch Complex 39A just before the Demo-1 launch at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

item.title: Watch This Space: The Latest From Moon to Mars
item.description: On the latest Watch This Space, NASA administrator Jim Bridenstine looks back at 15 years of discoveries by our Opportunity rover on Mars, and forward to new commercial partnerships for missions to the Moon.

item.title: Watch This Space: New Partnerships for Commercial Lunar Payload Delivery
item.description: Welcome to Watch This Space. I'm NASA administrator Jim Bridenstine, and NASA is going forward to the moon. This time we're doing it differently than we've ever done it before. Recently NASA announced nine commercial partners that will take NASA payloads to the surface of the moon.

item.title: Watch This Space: Astronaut Nick Hague
item.description: NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine talks via satellite with astronaut Nick Hague in Houston. Hague and Russian crewmate Alexey Ovchinin safely made a ballistic landing in Kazakhstan on Oct. 11, when the launch of their Soyuz spacecraft to the International Space Station was aborted due to an anomaly.

item.title: Watch This Space: Commercial Crew Astronauts Chris Ferguson and Suni Williams
item.description: During a visit to Johnson Space Center, NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine sits down with astronauts Chris Ferguson and Sunita “Suni” Williams for an informal Q&A session about the Commercial Crew Program.

item.title: Watch This Space: Webb Science with Nobel Laureate John Mather
item.description: NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine sits down with Nobel Prize winner John Mather and the agency's Associate Administrator for Science, Thomas Zurbuchen for a conversation about NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope.

item.title: Watch This Space: Astronauts Joe Acaba and Mark Vande Hei
item.description: During a visit to NASA Headquarters, astronauts Joe Acaba and Mark Vande Hei sit down for an informal Q&A session with Administrator Jim Bridenstine – and respond to questions from the agency’s social media followers.
